description: Uncertain; perhaps an extended form of razz(le-dazzle).

examples: He says he's late for the meeting because his daughter had an emergency at school, but I don't buy this razzmatazz.
A few politicians are creating some razzmatazz about reinstating the draft.

entries.meaning: (informal) Something presenting itself in a fanciful and showy, often unrealistic manner, especially when intended to impress and confuse.
examples: Is he really the next big thing, or is all the media attention just a bunch of razzmatazz?

entries.meaning: (rare) A long and imposing series of mindless but necessary tasks.
examples: When I finally got done dealing with all the razzmatazz of college registration, I decided to go out and have a drink.
